eu.stratosphere.nephele.template

Class AbstractInputTask<T extends InputSplit>

  • java.lang.Object

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of input splits generated by this input task
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractFileInputTask, AbstractGenericInputTask, GenericInputTask

    public abstract class AbstractInputTask<T extends InputSplit>
extends AbstractInvokable
    Abstract base class for tasks submitted as a part of a job input vertex.
    Author:
    warneke

    • Method Detail

      • computeInputSplits

        public abstract T[] computeInputSplits(int requestedMinNumber)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        This method computes the different splits of the input that can be processed in parallel. It needs to be implemented by classes that describe input tasks.

        Note that this method does not return the input splits for the task instance only, but it computes all splits for all parallel instances. Those computed splits are then assigned to the individual task instances by the Job Manager. To obtain the input splits for the current task instance, use the #getTaskInputSplits() method.

        Parameters:
        requestedMinNumber - The minimum number of splits to create. This is a hint by the system how many splits should be generated at least (typically because there are that many parallel task instances), but it is no hard constraint
        Returns:
        The input splits for the input to be processed by all instances of this input task
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getInputSplitType

        public abstract java.lang.Class<T> getInputSplitType()
        Returns the type of input splits that is generated by this input task.
        Returns:
        the type of input splits that is generated by this input task

      • getInputSplits

        public java.util.Iterator<T> getInputSplits()
        Returns an iterator to a (possible empty) list of input splits which is expected to be consumed by this instance of the AbstractInputTask.
        Returns:
        an iterator to a (possible empty) list of input splits.
